verses.text:
How long, O Lord, our Saviour,
Wilt thou remain away?
Our hearts are growing weary
Of thy so long delay;
O when shall come the moment
When we shall see thy face,
And find a sweet refreshing
In thy divine embrace?

How long shall Satan triumph?
How long shall darkness reign?
How long shall tears of sorrow
Flow down like summer rain?
O when shall come the morning
Of that eternal day,
When pain and sin and sorrow
Forever pass away?

How long shall we, thy people,
Be scattered and oppressed?
How long shall we be wandering
Unhappy and unblest?
O when shall we be gathered
Unto our native land,
And dwell in peace and safety
At thy right hand?

How long shall creation
In bondage groaning lie?
How long shall thorns and thistles
Grow up and multiply?
O when shall all thy creatures
Be freed from sin and pain,
And the whole earth be Eden
Once again?
